caption: Injured children were rushed to Al-Shifa Hospital on Sunday. It is one of 21 hospitals in Gaza that have been ordered to evacuate.
image_1.context: A fitness instructor, aged 26, she was drawn to trance music festivals as a means, she said, “to disconnect your mind from all the tension in Israel.” The Tribe of Nova gathering, celebrating the Jewish holiday of Sukkot amid groves of eucalyptus trees only three miles from Gaza, seemed particularly well organized, so the fireworks struck RE’IM, Israel — At daybreak, Hila Fakliro looked up to the sky from the vodka and Red Bull cocktails she was mixing: “Oh, my God,” she said. “Look! There are fireworks!” By ROGER COHEN A Rave, Then a Shattering Awakening, and Israel Is Transformed “All the News The New ork Cimes That's Fit to Print'" VOL. CLXXIII . . . . image_1.description: The image depicts a chaotic and urgent scene outside Al-Shifa Hospital in Gaza. Several injured children are being rushed to the hospital. On the left, a man is carrying a small child with visible injuries, including burns on the legs. The child appears to be in distress. Another man, wearing a green vest and gloves, is carrying an older child who is also injured and unconscious. The older child is being placed on a stretcher by medical personnel. In the background, there are other people, some of whom appear to be security personnel or police officers. The atmosphere is tense and urgent, with a sense of emergency and urgency. The setting is a paved area outside a building, likely the hospital, with a few windows visible in the background.

caption: The Board of Pardons in Minnesota meets twice a year to consider applications for clemency.
image_2.context: a car, syringe jutting In Minnesota, Seeking Pardons in Public The supplicants clustered outside the enormous closed doors. They paced the hallway, fidgeted on benches, knitted their hands and waited, waited, for their 10- minute chance at mercy. A tall man in a sharp blazer, caught a quarter-century ago with 127 doses of LSD. A pony-tailed Navy veteran who critically injured someone while driving drunk in 2008. A burly man twice convicted of assaulting his wife, now sitting beside him. A former addict once found unconscious in By DAN BARRY 10 Minutes to Plead for Grace, and a New Life party officials who were treated to an hourslong Mara-Lago meal in March that ended in ice cream sundaes. Months later, Mr. McDonald’s party in Nevada dramatically transformed the state’s influential early contest. The party enacted new rules that distinctively disadvantage Mr. Trump’s chief rival, Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida, by effectively blocking the super PAC he relies upon from participating in the state’s new caucus. Mr. McDonald has tilted the rules so significantly that some of Mr. Trump’s opponents have accused the party of manipulating the election for him — and have mostly pulled up stakes in the state entirely.
image_2.description: The image depicts a formal meeting of the Board of Pardons in Minnesota. The setting is a conference room with a wooden backdrop and two flags, one being the American flag and the other likely representing the state of Minnesota. Three individuals are seated at a long table, each behind nameplates indicating their roles: 'Attorney General,' 'Governor Walz,' and 'Chief Justice Gildea.' The individuals appear to be listening intently, possibly to a speaker not visible in the frame. In the foreground, there are two people sitting with their backs to the camera, one wearing a black top and the other a colorful shirt with a floral pattern. The atmosphere suggests a serious and formal event, likely involving discussions or hearings related to applications for clemency. The room is well-lit, and the overall mood conveys a sense of gravity and formality.

caption: Food donated to displaced Palestinians in Khan Younis.
image_3.context: At least 2,760 Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told government ministers on Sunday at the first formal meeting of Israel’s new emergency wartime government, acContinued on Page A8 After days of acute water short ages in Gaza, Jake Sullivan, the White House national security ad viser, said on Sunday that Israel had agreed to restore water to a pipeline that served a southern part of the enclave. As Israeli troops massed on the border, more than two million Gaza residents endured a pan icked countdown to the expected start of a ground invasion of northern Gaza. “We will take Hamas apart,”  an Israeli ground invasion appeared imminent. At the same time, the United States was deploying a second aircraft carrier to the eastern Mediterranean amid fears of a wider war. Officials from the United States, Egypt and Middle Eastern countries sought to ease what Israeli officials have called the “siege” of Gaza, which has led to dire shortages of food, water, gasoline and other essentials in the blockaded territory. Video images on Sunday showed lines of trucks idling on the road to Gaza in the Egyptian city of Arish, about 30 miles from the border they were not allowed to cross.
image_3.description: The image depicts a scene of food distribution to displaced Palestinians in Khan Younis. In the foreground, a man is seated on the ground, handling a metal tray and surrounded by various food items wrapped in plastic bags and aluminum foil. He appears to be distributing or organizing the food. To his left, there are several people standing around, some holding plastic bags, possibly waiting to receive their share of the food. The individuals are dressed in casual clothing, with colors ranging from light blue to dark gray. The background shows a street scene with buildings and a clear sky, suggesting an outdoor setting. The overall atmosphere conveys a sense of community support and aid during a time of need.

image_4.description: The image depicts a lively scene at a food cart. Two vendors, both wearing red shirts and caps, are serving customers from behind the counter of a bright red food cart. The cart has a sign that reads 'NETFLIX STREET FOOD' on it. One of the vendors is handing out food to a customer who is facing away from the camera, wearing a brown jacket and a backpack. Another customer, wearing glasses and a gray hoodie, is standing to the right, seemingly waiting for their order. The background shows a busy street with other people and buildings, suggesting an urban setting. The atmosphere appears bustling and energetic, with the vendors engaged in their work and the customers eagerly awaiting their food.

The individual is holding a microphone close to their mouth, suggesting they are singing or speaking. image_6.description: The image depicts the exterior of a modern airport terminal building. The architecture features a series of large, curved arches that form the roof structure, giving it a distinctive and futuristic appearance. The facade is composed of dark glass panels interspersed with white columns, creating a sleek and contemporary look. The name 'BOISEAIR' is prominently displayed in gold letters above the entrance. In front of the building, there are several vehicles, including taxis and buses, indicating an active transportation hub. The sky is clear with a few scattered clouds, suggesting a bright and sunny day. The overall atmosphere conveys a sense of modernity and efficiency, typical of a major international airport.
